meanings.definition: Using or expressed in vulgar and obscene language.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's scurrile jokes made the audience uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The movie was filled with scurrile language that was not suitable for children.
meanings.sent3: Despite his scurrile remarks, he managed to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her scurrile comments cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The author's scurrile descriptions painted a vivid picture of the gritty reality.

meanings.definition: Humorously mocking or derisive in a vulgar or obscene way.
meanings.sent1: The scurrile cartoon characters poked fun at societal norms.
meanings.sent2: His scurrile sense of humor often crossed the line of good taste.
meanings.sent3: The scurrile parody of the popular song had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her scurrile imitation of the teacher had the class in stitches.
meanings.sent5: The scurrile comedy show was a hit with the audience.
